metadata.title: CVE-2024-27021 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: r8169:fix LED-related deadlock on module removal Bindingdevm_led_classdev_register() to the netdev is problematic because on moduleremoval we get a RTNL-related deadlock. Fix this by avoiding thedevice-managed LED functions. Note: We can safely callled_classdev_unregister() for a LED even if registering it failed, becauseled_classdev_unregister() detects this and is a no-op in this case.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27021` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 6.2.0-20.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1003-laptop - 6.5.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-starfive - 6.5.0-1002.3
No subscription required
